segments.text: I see the woman lost in her world, the plate her sole focus.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a comfort in her routine, yet it feels so misplaced right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water spills over, cascading down like a silent scream for help.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t understand how she’s missing it all. Is she really that oblivious?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing higher, his little fingers reaching for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a thrill to it, but that thrill is tinged with danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish he would just come down; the stool doesn’t look stable at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl watches him with such wide-eyed excitement, her arm reaching up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s sweet, yet there’s a nagging feeling in my gut that warns me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the way the sunlight filters through the window, a beautiful contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This place should feel safe, but right now it feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout—a warning, a plea—but I hold back, feeling powerless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a strange mix of joy and anxiety watching their little quest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will they escape unscathed, or will this kitchen become a stage for disaster?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hold my breath as they teeter on the edge of fun and chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
